title: Schneider Electric's new research shows that digital and electric solutions can cut carbon emissions in office buildings ... - PR Newswire
summary: Research finds retrofitting buildings using a digital-first approach is the best pathway to decarbonization, offering up to 70% reduction in operational carbon emissions in office buildings.
green_innovation: TRUE. This research highlights the use of digital and electric solutions to significantly reduce operational carbon emissions in office buildings, thus contributing to environmental sustainability goals of decarbonization.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the implementation of new digital-first approaches in retrofitting buildings, which represents a significant advancement in business processes for decarbonization purposes.
green_product: FALSE. The article focuses on digital building and power management solutions for office buildings rather than specific physical goods or services that significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The research emphasizes the use of digital technologies and electric solutions for renovating buildings, highlighting methods that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in operations.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 238210 - Electrical Contractors and Other Wiring Installation Contractors, 541330 - Engineering Services, 541512 - Computer Systems Design Services, 561210 - Facilities Support Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article discusses tangible research findings and solutions related to decarbonization using digital and electric solutions, without making false or misleading environmental benefit claims.
